etymology.description: Depicts two blocks of metal -> original form of 鋁(鋁) (lǚ, 'ingot') -> borrowed phonetically for 膂(膂) (lǚ, 'spine') and 呂(呂) (lǚ, 'music notes')
etymology.interpretation: Initially a pictogram illustrating two disconnected metal blocks, the character 呂(呂) (lǚ, 'two blocks of metal') was later adapted by connecting the blocks, becoming stylized as it was repurposed for various meanings including 'spine' and 'music notes'.
etymology.simplification: 呂(呂) was adapted into 呂(吕) as a simplified form without altering the meaning, simplifying the lines to produce a more cursive appearance.

examples.chinese: 工匠将呂打造成精美的装饰品(工匠將呂打造成精美的裝飾品)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiàng jiāng Lǚ dǎzào chéng jīngměi de zhuāngshìpǐn.
examples.english: The artisan forged the two blocks of metal into an exquisite ornament.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在古墓中发现了呂(考古學家在古墓中發現了呂)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zài gǔmù zhōng fāxiànle Lǚ.
examples.english: The archaeologist discovered the two blocks of metal in the ancient tomb.
